review_title: I've had the opportunity to learn about myself and my technical skills in information technology feild.
job_title: PC Support Specialist in Honolulu, HI
pros: This organization is not too large so my ability to learn and grow has been a plus.
cons: None at the moment. There is room for growth.

pros: Amazing people. Most of the people there are hard workers and passionate about the work they do. It’s also a great entry-level medical job - good way to get your foot in the door for some training.
cons: The scheduling is all over the place. They’ll have you work three 12 hour days, have one day off, then work another 4 days before having another day off. It’s exhausting, and very difficult to maintain mental health and work/life balance. There’s also no parking for employees, so get ready to drive around looking for parking for 20 minutes before each shift and walking through some super sketchy areas (and hoping your car is still there/not vandalized after your shift). Pay is also pretty crappy. It’s stressful and physically/mentally difficult, and the pay isn’t fair for all that collections has to do.

pros: The blood bank of Hawaii has a good mission statement.  To save lives.  Everyone there is really nice and welcoming.  They are hard workers dedicated to their cause. The benefits there are awesome.
cons: Some down sides are the room for growth there. The pay is getting better but still seems like not paid enough for what they do. Management is iffy there.

pros: Good starting pay, great benefits, room for growth within the company.
cons: No structure within management, people make their own rules, no parking,

pros: Mission and values are the pros. Unfortunately the incredibly high turnover and low pay doesn’t allow buy in.
cons: Low. Pay, no 401k until 12 months, heavy workload.

pros: Good benefits. Good patients, travel points
Meet tons of people.  Doing something to help the greater good.
cons: Horrible turnover rate, schedules & zero leadership from management. It’s all about favoritism and who your friends with. So if you want to keep your job start brown nosing.
